properties.name: NIH Toolbox Positive Affect Survey
properties.definition_text:
This self-report measure assesses both activated (i.e., happiness, joy) as well as unactivated (i.e., serenity, peace) aspects of positive affect. Affect is defined as "feelings that reflect a level of pleasurable engagement with the 
environment, such as happiness, joy, excitement, enthusiasm and contentment." Each item administered has a 5-point scale with options ranging from ânot at allâ to âvery much.â Each survey is scored using IRT methods.
